com.github.xemiru.general

Class ArgumentParsers

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.xemiru.general.ArgumentParsers

  • public class ArgumentParsers
extends Object
    A collection of ArgumentParsers to use during command handling.

    It is best to statically import this class for use in implementations of CommandExecutor.

    • Field Detail

      • STRING

        public static final ArgumentParser<String> STRING
        Parses text input. The parser allows strings with whitespace if it receives unescaped single or double quotes.

      • REMAINING_STRING

        public static final ArgumentParser<String> REMAINING_STRING
        Parses text input. The parser will consume all remaining tokens of the raw arguments passed to it. Quotes are not considered special, unlike STRING.

      • NUMBER

        public static final ArgumentParser<Number> NUMBER
        Parses simple numerical input.

        The returned value is a double, but is returned as a Number for convenience.

      • INTEGER

        public static final ArgumentParser<Integer> INTEGER
        Parses simple integer input.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ArgumentParsers

        public ArgumentParsers()

    • Method Detail

      • anyOf

        public static <T> ArgumentParser<T> anyOf(ArgumentParser<T> parser,
                                          String choice,
                                          String... moreChoices)
        Generates an ArgumentParser accepting only the given choices.

        Choice selection is defined by strings to allow the typename to be generated and allow tab-completion against user input. Selection is case-insensitive, though the parser will always receive the exact string defined by choices passed to this method; user input is simply matched. The choices you give are passed to the provided parser to turn into usable tokens.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the choice objects
        Parameters:
        parser - the ArgumentParser used to parse choices into a usable type
        choice - the first choice
        moreChoices - more choices
        Returns:
        an ArgumentParser accepting only the choices given as valid tokens

      • or

        public static ArgumentParser<Object> or(ArgumentParser<?> parserA,
                                        ArgumentParser<?> parserB,
                                        ArgumentParser<?>... moreParsers)
        Generates an ArgumentParser that could resolve any parameter type with a corresponding parser.

        The resolution type of the parser is Object. It is up to the consumer of the parameter to check the resulting type in order to create a branching path.

        Note that the value is returned immediately by the first successful parser. The parsers are given input to evaluate in the order they were given to this method. This means one should try not to pass a parser that pretty much always succeeds as the first parser (e.g. STRING).

        Parameters:
        parserA - a parser
        parserB - another parser
        moreParsers - even more parsers
        Returns:
        an ArgumentParser that may resolve various types

      • remain

        public static <T> ArgumentParser<List<T>> remain(ArgumentParser<T> parser)
        Generates an ArgumentParser that consumes all remaining tokens using the provided parser.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the resolution type of the parser
        Parameters:
        parser - the parser to consume tokens with
        Returns:
        an ArgumentParser returning a list of parameters resolved from remaining tokens passed to it

      • opt

        public static <T> ArgumentParser<T> opt(ArgumentParser<T> parser,
                                        String def)
        Generates an ArgumentParser that consumes the provided default token if it was not provided with any tokens to begin with.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the resolution type of the parser
        Parameters:
        parser - the parser to consume tokens with
        def - the default token to pass to the parser if no tokens are available
        Returns:
        an ArgumentParser resolving an optional parameter

      • alt

        public static <T> ArgumentParser<T> alt(ArgumentParser<T> parser,
                                        T def)
        Generates an ArgumentParser that returns the provided default parameter if it was not provided with any tokens to begin with.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the resolution type of the parser
        Parameters:
        parser - the parser to consume tokens with
        def - the default token to pass to the parser if no tokens are available
        Returns:
        an ArgumentParser resolving an optional parameter

      • lenient

        public static <T> ArgumentParser<T> lenient(ArgumentParser<T> parser,
                                            String def)
        Generates an ArgumentParser that excuses ParseExceptions that result in SyntaxExceptions by passing a fallback token for the parser to consume should the former occur.

        Be warned of the side-effects of ignoring syntax exceptions. The RawArguments object is not rolled back when one is encountered, meaning a token that's part of a larger parameter (e.g. a quoted string) may be received by the next parser.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the resolution type of the parser
        Parameters:
        parser - the parser to consume tokens with
        def - the default token to pass to the parser if a SyntaxException would otherwise occur
        Returns:
        a lenient ArgumentParser

      • fallback

        public static <T> ArgumentParser<T> fallback(ArgumentParser<T> parser,
                                             T def)
        Generates an ArgumentParser that excuses ParseExceptions that result in SyntaxExceptions by instead returning a fallback parameter should the former occur.

        Be warned of the side-effects of ignoring syntax exceptions. The RawArguments object is not rolled back when one is encountered, meaning a token that's part of a larger parameter (e.g. a quoted string) may be received by the next parser.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the resolution type of the parser
        Parameters:
        parser - the parser to consume tokens with
        def - the default parameter to return if a SyntaxException would otherwise occur
        Returns:
        a lenient ArgumentParser

      • rename

        public static <T> ArgumentParser<T> rename(ArgumentParser<T> parser,
                                           String typename)
        Generates an ArgumentParser that is functionally identical to the one provided, with the only difference being the typename.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the resolution type of the parser
        Parameters:
        parser - the ArgumentParser to wrap around
        typename - the new typename to return
        Returns:
        a functionally identical ArgumentParser with a new typename
